translation: "I will explain this created practice for you.

source_sentence: 過去有佛，名毘婆尸，出現於世，教化已周，遷神涅槃。
translation: In the past, there was a Buddha named Vipaśyin who appeared in the world, completed his teaching, and moved to spiritual nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 彼佛法中，有十萬比丘，淨修梵行，閑居樂靜，依於一山。
translation: Among that Buddha's teachings, there were 100,000 monks who practiced pure purity and lived in quietude and happiness, depending on a single mountain.

source_sentence: 其山左右，有好林樹，華果茂盛蓊欝無比，其諸樹間，流泉浴池，清涼可樂。
translation: On the left and right of that mountain, there were beautiful groves of trees with flowers and fruits that were luxuriant and incomparable, and between those trees, there were running springs and bathing pools that were cool and pleasant.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，依慕住止，遵善行道，懃修不懈，悉具初果，乃至四果，無有凡夫。
translation: Those monks who then relied on them to abide, followed the path of good conduct, and cultivated it unremittingly had all attained the first realization up to the fourth realization, and there were no ordinary people.

source_sentence: 時有五百估客，共相合集，欲入大海，發引徑路，經由此山，見諸比丘剋心精懃，內懷欣敬，思欲設供。
translation: Five hundred connoisseurs had assembled together, and they wanted to enter the ocean, so they led a path past this mountain and saw the monks diligently working at heart, rejoicing in their hearts, and desiring to make offerings.

source_sentence: 時諸賈客，共相合率，往請眾僧，求索供養；值諸檀越，各各已請，日日相次，竟不從意。
translation: The monks were invited by the patrons together to ask for offerings, and the patrons invited each of the dongs to come back day after day, but they didn't agree.

source_sentence: 即詣眾僧，辭入大海。
translation: They then went to the saṃgha and resigned themselves to the ocean.

source_sentence: 『設我等眾，安隱來還，當設供養，願哀見許。』
translation: 'Suppose we all return in peace, and we'll make offerings, and I hope you'll kindly accept them.'

source_sentence: 時僧默然，允可受請。
translation: The saṃgha was silent and agreed to accept the invitation.

source_sentence: 眾賈入海，大獲珍寶，平安還至，到眾僧所，選眾妙寶最上價者，用施眾僧，規俟飲食，若食多者，隨意用之。
translation: The merchants went into the ocean, found great treasures, returned safely, and selected the most valuable of the many wonderful treasures to give to the monks, making sure they were fed, and if there was much to eat, they used it as they liked.

source_sentence: 於時眾僧受其寶物，持用付授僧摩摩帝。
translation: The saṃgha then accepted the treasures, held them in trust, and gave them to the saṃgha Māmati.

source_sentence: 於後眾僧，食具向盡，從其求索爾時珍寶，當用續食。
translation: Later, when the monks had run out of food supplies, they asked for the treasures they had at that time, which they would use to continue eating.

source_sentence: 時摩摩帝，答眾僧言：『賈客前時，自與我寶，何緣乃索？』
translation: Māmati then answered the monks, 'That customer gave me his own treasure when he was here, what are the reasons why he asked for it?'

source_sentence: 上座維那，語摩摩帝：『檀越前時，以寶施僧，令汝舉之。
translation: The elder vaiḍūrya said to Māmati, 'Don't forget that when you gave the saṃgha treasure, you were told to carry it.

source_sentence: 今僧食盡，當用裨佐。』
translation: Now that the saṃgha has eaten all of it, you should use it as an aid.'

source_sentence: 時摩摩帝，瞋恚而言：『汝曹噉屎！
translation: Māmati then became angry and said, 'You cocksucker!

source_sentence: 此寶是我所有，何緣乃索？』
translation: I own this treasure, so what are the reasons for claiming it?'

source_sentence: 時彼眾僧，見摩摩帝已起惡意，即便散去。
translation: Seeing that Māmati had risen in ill-will, the monks then scattered.

source_sentence: 由其欺僧惡口罵故，身壞命終，墮阿鼻獄，身常宛轉沸屎之中，歷九十二劫，乃從獄出。
translation: Because they deceived the saṃgha and bad-mouthed them, they were destroyed and fell into the avīci hell at the end of their lives, where their bodies were constantly in the boiling water and excrement, and they were released after 92 eons.

source_sentence: 今復墮此屎尿池中，經歷年歲，未得解脫。
translation: Now, he's fallen back into this pool of feces and urine for years and years, but he hasn't yet been liberated.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 過去有佛，名曰尸棄，將諸比丘，臨過此坑，示諸弟子，為說本末。
translation: In the past, there was a Buddha named Śikhin who brought a group of monks across this pit, showed them to his disciples, and explained the beginning and end.

source_sentence: 復次有佛，名曰隨葉，亦復將從諸比丘眾，往到其所，說其因緣，從此命終，還入地獄，經歷數萬億歲，其後命終復生是中。
translation: Then there was a Buddha named Śīśāsaka who also led a group of monks to his place, explained the causes and conditions, and returned to hell when his life ended there, where he spent trillions of years, and was reborn here when his life ended.

source_sentence: 次復有佛，名曰拘留秦，亦共徒眾，圍遶至此坑，垂示諸比丘，說其本末。
translation: Next, there was a Buddha named Kauṇḍinya who also accompanied his disciples around to this pit, showed the monks, and explained the beginning and end.

source_sentence: 次名拘那含牟尼佛，亦共弟子，來至此坑。
translation: The next name was Kanakamuni, who also came with his disciples to this pit.

source_sentence: 次迦葉佛，亦來至此，咸為弟子，說其因緣。
translation: Next, Kāśyapa Buddha also came here, and he and his disciples explained the causes and conditions for their arrival.

source_sentence: 次第七佛，我釋迦牟尼，今示汝等因緣本末，觀視其虫。
translation: The next seventh Buddha, I, Śākyamuni, will now show you the origins and causes of this pit and examine its worms.

source_sentence: 如是一切賢劫當來諸佛，各各皆爾，將諸弟子，到其坑所，指示其虫，說其曩昔所造因緣。」
translation: Thus, all the buddhas of the good eon who will come in the future will each bring their disciples to their pits, show them to the worms, and explain the causes and conditions they had created in the past."

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，聞佛所說，心驚毛竪，共相勅厲，慎護身口意業，信受佛語，歡喜奉行。
translation: When the monks heard what the Buddha taught, their hair stood on end in fear, and they all commanded each other to guard their physical, verbal, and mental actions carefully, accept the Buddha's words with confidence, and rejoice and hand them down.

source_sentence: （六九）沙彌均提品第六十二(丹本為六十九)
translation: (69) Śrāmaṇerī Cundī Chapter 62 (Danben: 69)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時尊者舍利弗，晝夜三時，恒以天眼，觀視世間，誰應度者，輙往度之。
translation: At the time, the Venerable Śāriputra was constantly observing the world with the divine eye during the three hours of the day and night, and he would always go to anyone who should be saved.

source_sentence: 爾時有諸估客，欲詣他國，其諸商人，共將一狗，至於中路。
translation: At the time, some merchants were planning to visit another country, and they all brought a dog to the middle of the road.

source_sentence: 眾賈頓息，伺人不看閑靜之時，狗便盜取眾賈人肉。
translation: The merchants took a moment to calm down, and when the people weren't looking at the quiet time, the dog stole the merchants' flesh.

source_sentence: 於時眾人即懷瞋恚，便共打狗，而折其脚，棄置空野，捨之而去。
translation: Being angry, the people then beat the dog together, broke its legs, and left it in an empty field.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗，遙以天眼，見此狗身，攣躃在地，飢餓困篤，懸命垂死，著衣持鉢，入城乞食，得已持出飛至狗所，慈心憐愍，以食施與。
translation: Śāriputra then, with his divine vision, saw this dog's body, stranded on the ground, starving, and dying, put on his robe and bowl, went into the city to solicit food, and when he had obtained it, he took his bowl and flew out to the dog's place.

source_sentence: 狗得其食，濟活餘命，心甚歡喜，倍加踊躍。
translation: When the dog got his food, it saved the rest of his life, and he was so happy that he jumped up and down.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗，即為其狗，具足解說微妙之法，狗便命終，生舍衛國婆羅門家。
translation: Śāriputra then explained the subtle teachings in detail to the dog, and the dog's life ended and it was born in Śrāvastī at the home of a brāhmaṇa.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗，獨行乞食，婆羅門見，而問之言：「尊者獨行，無沙彌耶？」
translation: Śāriputra was walking alone, begging for food, when the Brāhmaṇa saw him and asked, "Venerable, are there no śrāmaṇeras walking alone?"

source_sentence: 舍利弗言：「我無沙彌，聞卿有子，當用見與。」
translation: Śāriputra said, "I have no novice monk, but I've heard that you have a son whom you'll grant."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「我有一子字曰均提，年既孩幼，不任使令。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, "I have a son named Kunti who's too young to be ordered around.

source_sentence: 比前長大，當用相與。」
translation: He'll grow up from the previous one, and you'll have to give him to him."

source_sentence: 時舍利弗，聞彼語已，即戢在心，還至祇洹。
translation: Śāriputra then, after hearing those words, gathered himself in his mind and returned to Qipan.

source_sentence: 至年七歲，復來求之。
translation: When he was seven years old, he came back to ask for more.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門，即以其兒，付舍利弗，令使出家。
translation: The brāhmaṇa then gave Śāriputra his son and asked him to leave home.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗，便受其兒，將至祇洹，聽為沙彌，漸為具說種種妙法，心意開解，得阿羅漢，六通清徹，功德悉備。
translation: Śāriputra then accepted his son and returned to Jetavana, where he was listened to as an ascetic who gradually explained the various wonderful teachings in detail, awakened his mind, became an arhat, and attained the clarity of the six supernormal powers and the full accomplishment of virtue.

source_sentence: 時均提沙彌，始得道已，自以智力，觀過去世，本造何行，來受此形，得遭聖師，而獲果證？
translation: After he had first attained the way, Kauṇḍinya acknowledged with his own wisdom what actions he had taken in the past to receive this form, meet a noble teacher, and realize its fruit.

source_sentence: 觀見前身，作一餓狗，蒙我和上舍利弗恩，今得人身，并獲道果。
translation: He sees that he was once a hungry dog who, through the kindness of our friend Śāriputra, now has a human body and has attained the fruit of the path.

source_sentence: 欣心內發，而自念言：「我蒙師恩，得脫諸苦，今當盡身供給所須，永作沙彌，不受大戒。」
translation: Delighted, he aroused an inner sense of joy and said to himself, "I've been freed from suffering by the grace of my teacher, so now I will make all the offerings I need, become a monk forever, and not accept the great precepts."

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，而白佛言：「不審此人，曩昔之時，興何惡行，受此狗身？
translation: It was then that Ānanda said to the Buddha, "What bad deed did this person not examine in the past that led to this dog's body?

source_sentence: 造何善根，而得解脫？」
translation: What good roots are created that lead to liberation?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「乃往過去迦葉佛時，有諸比丘，集在一處。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Once upon a time, when Kāśyapa Buddha was alive, there were monks who gathered in one place.

source_sentence: 時年少比丘，音聲清雅，善巧讚唄，人所樂聽。
translation: Those young monks had a clear and elegant voice and were skilled at chanting, which people enjoyed listening to.

source_sentence: 有一比丘，年高耆老，音聲濁鈍，不能經唄，每自出聲，而自娛樂。
translation: There was a monk who was elderly, had a dull voice, and couldn't sing, so he would make his own noise and entertain himself.

source_sentence: 其老比丘，已得羅漢，沙門功德，皆悉具足。
translation: That elderly monk had already attained arhatship and all of the ascetic virtues were complete.

source_sentence: 于時年少妙音比丘，見老沙門音聲鈍濁，自恃好聲，而呵之言：『今汝長老，聲如狗吠。』
translation: Seeing the elderly monk's dull voice and his pride in his good voice, the young Sumati monk rebuked him, saying, 'Now, you're an elderly man whose voice is like a dog barking.'

source_sentence: 輕呵已竟，時老比丘，便呼年少：『汝識我不？』
translation: After he had finished gently chiding him, the older monk then called to the younger monk, 'Do you know me?'

source_sentence: 年少答言：『我大識汝，汝是迦葉佛時比丘。』
translation: The young man answered, 'I've come to know you well; you were a monk at the time of Kāśyapa Buddha.'

source_sentence: 上座答曰：『我今已得阿羅漢道，沙門儀式，悉具足矣。』
translation: The elder monk replied, 'Now, I've attained the path of the arhat, and I've fulfilled all the ascetic rituals.'

source_sentence: 時年少比丘，聞其所說，心驚毛竪，惶怖自責，即於其前，懺悔過咎。
translation: When the young monk heard what he said, his hair stood on end in fear and remorse, and he went before him to repent of his faults.

source_sentence: 時老比丘，即聽懺悔。
translation: The older monk then listened to his repentance.

source_sentence: 由其惡言，五百世中，常受狗身；由其出家持淨戒故，今得見我，蒙得解脫」。
translation: Because of his bad words, he had been subjected to the body of a dog for 500 lifetimes; because he left home and upheld the pure precepts, he has now been able to see me and has been liberated."

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，聞佛所說，歡喜信受，頂戴奉行。
translation: Then Ānanda, hearing what the Buddha taught, rejoiced and believed it, put his trust in it, and approved of it.

source_sentence: 賢愚經卷第十三
translation: Sutra of Bhadraśriputra, Vol. 13
